sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The comentaries of M. Iohn Caluin vpon the first Epistle of Sainct Ihon, and vpon the Epistle of Iude wherein accordyng to the truthe of the woordes of the holie Ghost, he most excellently openeth and cleareth the poinct of true iustification with God, and sanctification by the Spirit of Christ, by the effects that he bryngeth forthe in the regeneration. Translated into Englishe by W.H. Commentaire sur l'épistre canonique de S. Jean. English Calvin, Jean, 1509-1564. Calvin, Jean, 1509-1564. Exposition sur l'épistre de S. Jude. aut W. H.
[16], 108, [27] leaves
By Ihon Kyngstone [and T. East], for Iohn Harrison the yonger, Imprinted at London : [ca. 1580]
Translation of "Commentaire sur l'épistre canonique de S. Jean" and "Exposition sur l'épistre de S. Jude". Publication date estimated by STC. Signatures: A-B ² B-O P⁴ ³B-D ² E² [² F]¹. "East pr[inted]. 2nd B-P, Kingston the rest"--STC. With a disjunct errata leaf at end. Variant 1: lacking this leaf. The last conjugate leaf is blank. Variant 2: recto of this leaf has "To the reader" signed: W.H. Reproduction of the original in the University of Chicago. Library.
=======
The comentaries of M. Iohn Caluin vpon the first Epistle of Sainct Ihon, and vpon the Epistle of Iude wherein accordyng to the truthe of the woordes of the holie Ghost, he most excellently openeth and cleareth the poinct of true iustification with God, and sanctification by the Spirit of Christ, by the effects that he bryngeth forthe in the regeneration. Translated into Englishe by W.H. Commentaire sur l'épistre canonique de S. Jean. English Calvin, Jean, 1509-1564. Calvin, Jean, 1509-1564. Exposition sur l'épistre de S. Jude. aut W. H.
[16], 108, [27] leaves
By Ihon Kyngstone [and T. East], for Iohn Harrison the yonger, Imprinted at London : [ca. 1580]
Translation of "Commentaire sur l'épistre canonique de S. Jean" and "Exposition sur l'épistre de S. Jude". Publication date estimated by STC. Signatures: A-B ² B-O P⁴ ³B-D ² E² [² F]¹. "East pr[inted]. 2nd B-P, Kingston the rest"--STC. With a disjunct errata leaf at end. Variant 1: lacking this leaf. The last conjugate leaf is blank. Variant 2: recto of this leaf has "To the reader" signed: W.H. Reproduction of the original in the University of Chicago. Library.
Iohn Harrison the yonger
Ihon Kyngstone
T. East]
